definition: to talk big/to shoot off one's mouth/to chat (dialect)
to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
to resort to bragging and flattering

sentences.english: A boaster and a liar are cousins.
Maybe it is because that boasting is tax-free that they dare to boast more and more.
sentences.chinese: 也許因爲吹牛是免稅的，他們纔敢大吹特吹。

sentences.english: He is always boasting, so no one trusts him.
sentences.chinese: 他總是吹牛皮，沒人相信他。

sentences.english: There is no need to criticize or brag.
sentences.chinese: 因爲沒有批判和吹牛的必要。

sentences.english: The charlatan boasted that he could charm off any disease.
sentences.chinese: 這個江湖騙子吹牛說他能用符咒治好各種疾病。

sentences.english: Look that know-it-all fellow is talking big again.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，那個自以爲是的傢伙又在吹牛了。

sentences.english: Blowhards who make claims that they can't back up.
sentences.chinese: 那些在不能支持的要求上吹牛的人。

sentences.english: Beginners like to brag, experts like to listen.
sentences.chinese: 新手喜歡吹牛，專業人士喜歡細聽。

sentences.english: Boylan told him later, saying he had learned his trade watching Mr. Graham perform.
sentences.chinese: 他說，他在觀看格雷厄姆的表演時學會了吹牛的訣竅。

sentences.english: They often talk horse when they are free.
sentences.chinese: 他們有空時常常在一起吹牛。

sentences.english: There are lots of phonies and charlatans in the financial newsletter business.
sentences.chinese: 幹金融通訊這一行的人中間不乏騙子和吹牛大王。

sentences.english: A boaster and a liar are all one .
sentences.chinese: 愛吹牛的人和騙子都是一丘之貉。

sentences.english: He wants to outpsych you, don't listen to his bull.
sentences.chinese: 別聽他吹牛，他只不過想唬住你。

sentences.english: 'That is where the world's biggest liars come from.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是世界上最棒吹牛大王的家鄉。

sentences.english: He is nothing but a big bluffer.
sentences.chinese: 他是個吹牛大王，經常吹牛。

sentences.english: He is nothing but a big bluffer.
sentences.chinese: 他是個吹牛大王，經常吹牛。

definition: to boast/to shoot one's mouth off
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
(idiom) to have a glib tongue/to talk big
